intro: Acyntha, commonly known as the common thistle, is a genus of flowering plants in the family Asteraceae. It consists of several species, many of which are characterized by their spiny leaves and purple or pink flowers. These plants are typically found in temperate regions and are often adapted to thrive in dry, disturbed soils. Acyntha species are perennial herbs that produce achene fruits, which are dispersed by wind. Their botanical features make them important components of various ecosystems and valuable for pollinators.
